alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Southern Carroll; Strafford; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 11 at 6:46AM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Runoff from rainfall and snowmelt continues through flood threat through this evening... Widespread rainfall overnight and continuing through today will combine with snowmelt to cause flood problems across the region. The heaviest rainfall will occur in the Kennebec Valley and midcoast regions where the flood risk is highest. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Coastal York, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior Waldo, Interior York, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc, Southern Franklin, Southern Oxford and Southern Somerset and New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Coastal Rockingham, Eastern Hillsborough, Interior Rockingham, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Southern Carroll, Strafford and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas and small streams is possible through this evening. Some river flooding is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches fell overnight, with rain continuing through this afternoon. This in combination with snowmelt will produce excessive runoff.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Southern Carroll; Strafford; Western And Central Hillsborough
